channel.title: seqspec on Not A Rocket Scientist
channel.description: Recent content in seqspec on Not A Rocket Scientist

item.title: PIPseq$^{\textmd{TM}}$ V4 Update
item.description: NOTE: this post is just a slightly more detailed version of this Twitter thread. Not very long after I wrote the series about guessing the library layout of PIP-seq, the raw data (FASTQ files) for the V4 chemistry were made available from the FluentBio website, which is really nice. Now let’s have a look at what has been changed. The experimental procedures seem to remain the same. What about the library layout and barcodes?

item.title: Guessing Library Structures (4) - PIP-seq V1prototype
item.description: Portal Guessing Library Structures (1) - Background Guessing Library Structures (2) - PIPseq$^{\textmd{TM}}$ V3 Guessing Library Structures (3) - PIP-seq V2 Guessing Library Structures (4) - PIP-seq V1prototype This is the fourth post, also the last, from a series where I use the recent PIP-seq data as an example to demonstrate the importance to use a common standard like seqspec to accompany sequencing reads submissions into public repositories. The V1?

item.title: Guessing Library Structures (3) - PIP-seq V2
item.description: Portal Guessing Library Structures (1) - Background Guessing Library Structures (2) - PIPseq$^{\textmd{TM}}$ V3 Guessing Library Structures (3) - PIP-seq V2 Guessing Library Structures (4) - PIP-seq V1prototype This is the third post from a series where I use the recent PIP-seq data as an example to demonstrate the importance to use a common standard like seqspec to accompany sequencing reads submissions into public repositories. Some Notes In the previous post, we have figured out the library structure of many samples from the Clark2023 paper.

item.title: Guessing Library Structures (2) - PIPseq$^{\textmd{TM}}$ V3
item.description: Portal Guessing Library Structures (1) - Background Guessing Library Structures (2) - PIPseq$^{\textmd{TM}}$ V3 Guessing Library Structures (3) - PIP-seq V2 Guessing Library Structures (4) - PIP-seq V1prototype This is the second post from a series where I use the recent PIP-seq data as an example to demonstrate the importance to use a common standard like seqspec to accompany sequencing reads submissions into public repositories. An Initial Look The PIP-seq method was originally put on bioRxiv on 13 June 2022.

item.title: Guessing Library Structures (1) - Background
item.description: Portal Guessing Library Structures (1) - Background Guessing Library Structures (2) - PIPseq$^{\textmd{TM}}$ V3 Guessing Library Structures (3) - PIP-seq V2 Guessing Library Structures (4) - PIP-seq V1prototype This is the first post from a series where I use the recent PIP-seq data as an example to demonstrate the importance to use a common standard like seqspec to accompany sequencing reads submissions into public repositories. What’s The Problem? There are many interesting questions we can ask, but to what extent can we investigate and do research on them?
